title: Australian treasurer says talks with Facebook on new media law were â€˜protracted and difficult'
text: Passage of the law made Australia the first country where a government-appointed arbitrator can decide on the price digital platforms have to pay publishers.

title: Facebook to lift its ban on political advertising
text: Facebook said it plans to lift a moratorium on US political advertising this Thursday, ending a ban that had been in place since the November elections.

title: Facebook Ends Ban on Political Advertising
text: The social network had prohibited political ads on its site indefinitely after the November election. Such ads have been criticized for spreading misinformation.

title: Facebook says it will resume political ads March 4
text: Facebook Inc. is resuming political, electoral, and social issue advertising Thursday after a temporary ban following the November 2020 U.S. presidential election. "Unlike other platforms, we require authorization and transparency not just for political and electoral ads, but also for social issue ads, and our systems do not distinguish between these categories," Facebook said in a post Wednesday.

title: Is Facebook A Buy Today In The Face Negative News Flow?
text: Facebook released blockbuster Q4 results, but the stock moved in reverse on a mix of anti-trust, iOS 14/privacy, and regulatory concerns.

title: Facebook will allow political ads again starting March 4
text: The company said in October it would be halting political advertising for an indefinite period after the election to prevent confusion or abuse.

title: Forget AMC and GameStop: 1 Popular Robinhood Stock to Buy
text: Why this stock is a far better investment than AMC and GameStop.

title: 3 Stocks Set to Gain on a Likely Rebound in Ad Spending
text: Global advertising investment is likely to increase in 2021, led by a digital shift, making it wise to invest in names like Interpublic Group of Companies (IPG), Facebook (FB) and Omnicom (OMC).
